content:
Intents:
Request a Dell computer: User is submitting a request to purchase or receive a new Dell laptop, Dell pc or Dell desktop computer.  This request does not cover Lenovo or Mac computers.
Return a computer: User needs to return or hand in their old laptop, pc or desktop computer.
Problem with a computer: User is experiencing some sort of issue with their laptop, pc or desktop computer.
Rebuild computer: User is requesting to have their laptop rebuilt.

Entities:
computer.brand: Dell, Lenovo, Mac
computer.type: laptop, pc, desktop

You will be given a sample that may contain more than one sentence. Your task is to assess the intent that the sample belongs to.  In addition, you should also identify any corresponding entities in the sample.  If a sample can belong to more than one intent, you should prioritize based on the following:

•	If "Request a Dell computer" and "Return a computer" are returned, prioritize "Request a Dell computer", since a user will need to have the new computer before turning in their old one.
•	If "Return a computer" and "Problem with a computer" are returned, prioritize "Problem with a computer", since it is better to fix an issue instead of turning in the affected computer.
•	If "Problem with a computer" and "Request a Dell computer" are returned, prioritize "Problem with a computer", since it is better to fix an issue instead of ordering a new computer.
•	If all four intents are returned, prioritize "Problem with a computer", since it is better to fix an issue instead of ordering a new computer or returning an affected one.
•	"Rebuild computer" should always be returned as the last intent if multiple intents are returned.

Given the above criteria, classify the following utterance in a json output:

--------- Begin Utterance --------------

“I just want to turn this Mac in.  I am having so many problems with it.  It just won’t work correctly.  I also need to get a new Lenovo pc to replace it ASAP.”

--------- End Utterance --------------


Additional context:

Conditions warranting replacement:
Lost/Stolen, irreparable damage and end-of-life are the only acceptable reasons to replace a laptop. Following are some specifics for each condition.
 
•	Lost/Stolen – In the event of lost or stolen it is the responsibility of the end-user to provide the circumstances under which an asset was lost.
•	Evidence of a reasonable effort to recover the asset in the case of lost is required. (Letters or emails to lost and found, inquiries to airport or taxi companies etc.).   
•	If an asset is reported stolen, a police report from the local law enforcement agency is required. 

o	An Incident must be submitted for all lost/Stolen laptops
o	The employee will need to Request a replacement device using the Computer catalog item under DT Hardware and Software option on the Surf employee portal
o	Select Laptop type
o	Select Reason for Order: Lost or Stolen
o	Enter Description of what happened?
o	Enter Did the Laptop contained sensitive information?
o	If you have already created an Incident ticket, please select 'Yes'
o	Enter Incident #.
o	If you have not created an Incident ticket, please select 'No'
o	Attach Police Report, If you don't have a Police Report for Stolen laptop, please have one created and attach it to the Request at a later point.
o	Submit 'Request'.
o	Replacement device will be of comparable functionality, fulfilled from stock on hand
 
•	Asset issues –   

o	An Incident must be submitted for all type of asset issues
o	The DT Support Organization will troubleshoot to fix the asset issue
o	If an asset cannot be repaired, the asset will be retired, and used for spare parts and shell swaps or processed by an approved E-waste recycler.
o	The DT Support team will issue a replacement device of comparable functionality, fulfilled from stock on hand
 
•	End of Life – This refers to devices that have been identified as End of Service or End of Life based on our policy.
o	As a ServiceNow employee, you are eligible to replace your laptop if it is older than 3 years (this is the identified useful life based on our policy).•	
o	How do you check to see when your laptop is scheduled for replacement?
	Go to Employee Portal: Under Home -> My Information -> My Stuff 
	This will bring up all the assets that have been assigned to you
	Eligible for replacement date is listed under Computer 
o	How do you submit the 'replacement request'?
	If the 'Eligible for replacement' date is past, then you can request a replacement laptop by clicking on that option
	Select Laptop type
	Select Reason for Order: Replacing an existing laptop
	Enter Home or office delivery and address
	Submit 'Request'.
